pr_title: Null checks in translators and general improvements

timeline.bodyText: @varung-31Thanks for working on this,what if we also used type instead of reference.getType()  on the line of the exception? cc   @ibacher
timeline.author: HerbertYiga

timeline.bodyText: Please actually leave this on the interface. I'm intending for the Javadocs to go on interfaces where possible.
timeline.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: But this is unnecessary repetition. This method is already present in the BaseFhirService, why do we want to declare it here as well?
replies.author: varung-31

replies.bodyText: To have a per-type Javadoc, which should be, but hasn't been the standard. In most cases it doesn't matter, but it some cases it might.
replies.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: This needs to be updated, not removed.
timeline.author: ibacher
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -21,15 +21,6 @@
  */
 public interface FhirTaskService extends FhirService<Task> {
 	
-	/**
-	 * Get list of tasks that reference the object type/UUID combo provided
-	 *
-	 * @param basedOnReference
-	 * @param ownerReference
-	 * @param status
-	 * @param sort
-	 * @return the collection of Tasks that match the search parameters
-	 */

replies.bodyText: Are we planning to have java docs on both the interfaces and the implementation? I think just having them on the interfaces suffices.
replies.author: varung-31

replies.bodyText: Largely just on interfaces, but if FM2-268 is implemented (or as we gradually migrate towards that) it may be necessary to have the Javadoc on some implementations when there is no appropriate interface anymore.
replies.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: I would prefer that on create we always assign a new UUID.
timeline.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: This needs to be updated, not removed.
timeline.author: ibacher
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -44,15 +44,6 @@
 	@Autowired
 	private SearchQuery<FhirTask, Task, FhirTaskDao, TaskTranslator> searchQuery;
 	
-	/**
-	 * Get a list of Tasks that match the given search and sort criteria
-	 *
-	 * @param basedOnReference A reference to a basedOn resource
-	 * @param ownerReference A reference to an owner resource
-	 * @param status The list of statuses for requested Tasks
-	 * @param sort
-	 * @return the saved task
-	 */

timeline.author: ibacher
ibacher

replies.bodyText: Yes, because if fhirAllergy is null and we are not returning null here or throwing an exception, it would lead to a new instance of Allergy being returned.
replies.author: varung-31

replies.bodyText: Oh right! I missed that! Cheerfully withdrawn!
replies.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: Is this change strictly-speaking necessary? I understand that id elements can be more complex so that getId() doesn't just return the id, but in this case that would actually indicate a bug in the code and so the test should fail.
timeline.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText:
If you try to step in through a debugger, you would see that patient.getId() would have the value as "null" and there was a gap in the patient translator because of which it was returning a new instance.
Generally speaking, patient.getId() has the value as Patient/<uuid>, whereas patient.getIdElement().getIdPart() has the value as <uuid>, hence in my opinion this change is necessary.
replies.author: varung-31
